nz.org.venice.parser.expression
Class TrendExpression

java.lang.Object
  nz.org.venice.parser.expression.AbstractExpression
      nz.org.venice.parser.expression.TernaryExpression
          nz.org.venice.parser.expression.TrendExpression
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, Expression
public class TrendExpression
extends TernaryExpression

An expression which generates the trend line over the quote and extrapolates the next value.

Author:
Mark Hummel

Constructor Detail

TrendExpression

public TrendExpression(Expression quote,
                       Expression days,
                       Expression lag)
Create a new trend expression for the given quote kind, for the given number of days, starting with lag days away, and the given value.

Parameters:
quote - the quote kind to average
days - the number of days to average over
lag - the offset from the current day

evaluate

public double evaluate(Variables variables,
                       QuoteBundle quoteBundle,
                       Symbol symbol,
                       int day)
                throws EvaluationException
Description copied from interface: Expression
Evaluates the given expression and returns the result.

Parameters:
variables - variable storage area for expression
quoteBundle - the quote bundle containing quote data to use
symbol - the current symbol
day - current date in cache fast access format
Returns:
the result of the expression
Throws:
EvaluationException - if the expression performs an illegal operation such as divide by zero.
